greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Compound filter (for counting primes of form 6k+1, 6k+2, 6k+3 and 6k+5): a(n) = 6*A032742(n) + (A020639(n) mod 6), a(1) = 1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: With[{k = 6}, Table[Function[{p, d}, k d + Mod[p, k] - k Boole[n == 1]] @@ {#, n/#} &@ FactorInteger[n][[1, 1]], {n, 85}]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 12 2017 *)
program: def a(n): return 1 if n==1 else 6*divisors(n)[-2] +(min(primefactors(n))%6) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 12 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 11 2017
